answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some recourses which may offer you a start.
Below is a sample Pothole Policy from Arapahoe, CO.
http://www.co.arapahoe.co.us/Departments/PW/documents/21%20Appendix%20E%20-%20Pothole%20Repair%20Revised%2012-27-06.pdf
The City of Tempe, AZ Utility Permit and Construction Manual has a section for potholes beginning on page 6.
http://www.tempe.gov/engineering/dry_utilities/utility_permit_manual_08.pdf
For more information on different methods of filling potholes I included this report  called,  Evaluation of Pothole Patching Materials conducted by Dept. of Civil & Environmental Engineering Center for Advanced Infrastructure & Transportation (CAIT) at Rutgers University.
http://www.qprcoldpatch.com/pdf/Rutgers-Study.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Will Weber
text: Oregon law requires positive locating of utilities pror to excavation. Potholing over marked locations is generally done. What are the pothole patching requirements (details) that roadway authorities are requiring to patch the pavement cuts? What if the roadways have been recently paved? Is anyone using patch back material other than hot mix for their permanent patch?
title: Utility locate potholes
